snippet: A video on YouTube has raised awareness about the Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony — and spurred a wave of criticism from pundits about the often simplistic nature of online activism.
abstract: Noam Cohen Link by Link column; charity Invisible Children has put out YouTube video Kony 2012 about Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony and his Lord's Resistance Army, pitched to a 5-year-old's sense of right and wrong; video has raised awareness, but also sparked criticism about the often simplistic nature of online activism.
lead_paragraph: A video on YouTube has raised awareness about the Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony — and spurred a wave of criticism from pundits about the often simplistic nature of online activism.

headline.seo: ‘Kony 2012’ Video Illustrates the Power of Simplicity
headline.main: A Video Campaign and the Power of Simplicity
headline.print_headline: A Video Campaign and the Power of Simplicity
